Your team ensures that Zaps run reliably, efficiently, and at scale, while evolving the system to support new product capabilities and performance requirements.

This platform is mission-critical: any improvement or regression in the execution pipeline has a ripple effect across Zapier’s customer base. Leading the Runner team means driving innovations that make the platform more resilient, scalable, and developer-friendly — while partnering closely with internal stakeholders who build on top of it.

If you're passionate about high-scale distributed systems, building platform capabilities for other engineers, and coaching senior engineers on tough, systems-level challenges, this role could be a great fit.

 - Our Commitment to Applicants https://zapier.com/jobs/our-commitment-to-applicants/

 - Culture and Values at Zapier https://zapier.com/jobs/culture-and-values-at-zapier/

 - Zapier Guide to Remote Work https://zapier.com/learn/remote-work/

 - Zapier Code of Conduct https://zapier.com/jobs/zapier-code-of-conduct/

 - Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier https://zapier.com/jobs/working-on-diversity-and-inclusivity/


ABOUT YOU

 - You have deep experience building and operating complex distributed systems at scale. You’ve worked in high-volume production environments and bring a strong reliability mindset. You treat outages as opportunities to improve and invest in system-wide visibility, graceful degradation, and operational excellence.

 - You’ve built and led platform teams. You understand how to build infrastructure consumed by other product teams, and you're skilled at managing internal customer relationships through effective feedback loops, rituals, and roadmap planning.

 - You lead senior engineers through strategy and mentorship. You’ve managed and grown high-performing engineers at the senior and staff levels, helping them scale their impact while driving alignment around a cohesive technical direction.

 - You’re customer- and data-driven. You understand the downstream impact of infrastructure changes on end users, and you define and monitor success metrics that reflect reliability and business value. You're confident adapting priorities month-to-month based on what the data tells you and clearly communicate tradeoffs to peers and executives.

 - You’re comfortable with our tech stack. You have hands-on experience with Python and have built systems using AWS services like SQS, S3, and Lambda, optimizing for both performance and cost.

 - You collaborate with clarity and empathy. You bring teams together, working across product, design, support, and infrastructure to solve problems. You communicate complex ideas in a simple way, and you're skilled at keeping stakeholders informed and aligned.

 - You think like a product owner. You know how to shape and prioritize a platform roadmap that supports long-term technical health while unlocking new capabilities for internal builders. You make room for foundational investments like tech debt paydown while delivering user-facing improvements.


THINGS YOU’LL DO

 - Lead the Runner team: support a group of experienced engineers in building and evolving Zapier’s Zap Execution platform.

 - Drive platform excellence: ensure the execution pipeline is robust, observable, performant, and cost-effective.

 - Collaborate across Zapier to ensure the platform supports the needs of internal teams building automation features, AI workflows, and more.

 - Establish and maintain strong platform stakeholder relationships through regular syncs, roadmap reviews, and clear documentation.

 - Coach and develop senior and staff-level engineers through 1:1s, mentorship, and growth planning.

 - Shape the quarterly and long-term technical roadmap for the Zap Execution platform, working closely with Product and Infrastructure partners.

 - Ensure your team adheres to Zapier’s engineering best practices, including security, reliability, and architectural guidelines.

 - Continuously improve the development and release processes through retrospectives, process refinements, and technical tooling.

 - Define and track metrics related to Zap execution success, reliability, and platform health, and communicate these to executive leadership to inform planning and prioritization.

 - Contribute to hiring and onboarding new engineers to the team and company.

 - Stay close to the user impact of platform changes by collaborating with support, product, and customer-facing teams.


HOW TO APPLY

At Zapier, we believe that diverse perspectives and experiences make us better, which is why we have a non-standard application process designed to promote inclusion and equity. We're looking for the best fit for each of our roles, regardless of the type of companies in your background, so we encourage you to apply even if your skills and experiences don’t exactly match the job description. Zapier is an equal-opportunity employer and we're excited to work with talented and empathetic people of all identities. jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Zapier

We're humans who simply think computers should do more work.

At Zapier, we’re not just making software—we’re building a platform to help millions of businesses globally scale with automation and AI. Our mission is to make automation work for everyone by delivering products that delight our customers. You’ll collaborate with brilliant people, use the latest tools, and leverage the flexibility of remote work. Your work will directly fuel our customers’ success, and as they grow, so will you.

Hi there!

Zapier is on a mission to democratize automation while protecting the security and privacy of millions of users worldwide. We’re hiring a Sr. Security Engineer to partner closely with GTM, sales, engineering, and product teams to build customer trust and serve as a technical security advisor throughout the sales cycles.


  • Our Commitment to Applicants

  • Culture and Values at Zapier

  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work

  • Zapier Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier


About the Role

This role blends deep security expertise with strong communication and business acumen, enabling the organization to confidently address complex security requirements from prospects, customers, and partners. Acting as a bridge between customer’s security teams and Zapier, this role also works closely with internal product and cross-functional security teams to ensure alignment between customer requirements and Zapier’s security capabilities.


Things You’ll Do

  • Build expertise in Zapier’s internal security practices and our platform’s governance features.

  • Act as a strategic security advisor to sales and customer success teams on security-related aspects of complex or high-value deals.

  • Lead rapid response to technical risk mitigation for concerns raised by customers during deal cycles.

  • Represent the company’s security posture and lead customer-facing security briefings to address security concerns and accelerate trust.

  • Consult on the voice of the customer on security related issues and help translate customer requirements into actionable feedback for internal product and security teams, influencing roadmap and priorities.

  • Get ahead of potential concerns by partnering with enterprise GTM teams, analyzing customer security questionnaires, and identifying improvements in our platform’s governance features.

  • Develop and maintain sales enablement content: Trust Center knowledge base, security one-pagers, objection handling guides, and whitepapers.

  • Collaborate with product marketing to ensure security messaging aligns with customer needs and market expectations.

About You

  • 7+ years in technical security roles: application security, product security, or security consulting with customer-facing experience.

  • Understanding of code and architecture: you can discuss security controls and design decisions with developers

  • Deep knowledge of application security: API security, authentication/authorization patterns, data protection, and secrets management

  • Familiarity with Encryption, IAM, and cloud-native architectures (AWS, GCP, Azure).

  • Understanding of risks and mitigations for LLMs and GenAI applications.

  • Familiarity with compliance frameworks such as SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA, GDPR

  • Experience with using AI tools for high-impact, role-relevant opportunities to improve speed, quality, and outcomes.

  • Experience partnering cross-functionally with internal engineering and product teams to drive security initiatives.

  • Experience translating customer requirements into actionable engineering and product priorities.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills: ability to explain technical concepts clearly to technical and non-technical audiences including customers, sales teams, and executives.

  • Prior experience working with customers: addressing customer questions and concerns, reviewing customer input, working cross-functionally with customer facing teams.

  • Ability to build customer-facing content and speak with confidence in high-pressure engagements

  • Experience working alongside account executives, customer success managers, or solution engineers and engaging with customers in security-sensitive deals.

Bonus points for:

  • Developer background (you've written production code)

  • Security consulting or advisory experience

  • Solutions engineering or technical sales experience with a focus on security and governance

  • Public speaking or content creation on security topics

    • Evangelize Zapier’s enterprise-ready, citizen development-centric approach to the market.

In fact, throughout the process, we strive to never go more than seven days without letting you know the status of your application. Zapier will consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.

Zapier prioritizes the security of our customers' information and is dedicated to adhering to all applicable data privacy laws. You can review our privacy policy here.

If reasonable accommodations are needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact jobs@zapier.com.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer - West Coast
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Zapier

We're humans who simply think computers should do more work.

At Zapier, we’re not just making software—we’re building a platform to help millions of businesses globally scale with automation and AI. Our mission is to make automation work for everyone by delivering products that delight our customers. You’ll collaborate with brilliant people, use the latest tools, and leverage the flexibility of remote work. Your work will directly fuel our customers’ success, and as they grow, so will you.

Site Reliability Engineer

Job Posted: October 1st, 2025

Location: Remote, NAMER (West Coast)

Zapier’s Internal Platform provides engineers with a reliable, frictionless foundation for building, shipping, and operating software. Our Reliability Platform team owns observability, incident response, and service ownership, and we’re hiring a Site Reliability Engineer to help strengthen Zapier’s reliability posture.

Want to learn more about working at Zapier?

We know we have a lot of competition for your skills. If you’re wondering what things would be like at Zapier, read on about:

  • Our Commitment to Applicants

  • Culture and Values at Zapier

  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work

  • Zapier Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

Why This Role Matters

This isn’t just an infrastructure or tooling role. We’re looking for an engineer who’s excited to get hands-on with Zapier’s reliability challenges. You’ll help improve how we observe our systems, detect and respond to incidents, and build the systems that make Zapier more resilient at scale.

About You

  • You’re an experienced engineer with 4+ years in systems, infrastructure, or backend software roles (SaaS, cloud-native environments preferred).

  • You thrive writing production-grade code — in Go, Python, or something equivalent.

  • You’ve worked with infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, or equivalent), cloud (AWS), and container orchestration (Kubernetes).

  • You have hands-on experience with observability (metrics, logging, dashboards, alerts) and can reason about instrumentation and alert design.

  • You enjoy solving complex systems challenges and finding ways to improve performance and reliability.

  • You’re comfortable jumping into incidents, diagnosing across telemetry, coordinating with teams, and contributing to postmortems.

  • You think proactively about reducing toil and automating repetitive work.

  • You’re comfortable influencing peers by suggesting better practices, reviewing designs, and driving small cross-team improvements.

  • You communicate clearly—whether in async docs, real-time discussions, or knowledge sharing with the team.

  • You align with Zapier’s values and thrive in a collaborative, remote-first environment.

  • You approach new tools and ideas with curiosity and openness—especially around AI in reliability workflows. You’ve experimented with AI tools (or are eager to learn) and see them as part of your everyday toolkit.

Things You’ll Do

  • Build and improve platform tooling that helps Zapier engineers observe and operate their services.

  • Partner with product teams to raise the bar on observability and incident response.

  • Operate and evolve core observability systems, including logging, metrics, alerting, and dashboards.

  • Participate in the team’s on-call rotation for owned services and contribute to Zapier’s broader incident response program by improving the processes, tooling, and practices we use to detect, respond, and learn.

  • Write code to automate operations, improve developer experience, and reduce manual toil.

  • Contribute to infrastructure reliability by working with AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, and other core technologies.

  • Help shape observability and reliability best practices: review instrumentation designs, suggest improvements, and advocate for effective alerting.

  • Share knowledge through documentation, pairing, and mentoring.

We're humans who simply think computers should do more work.

Location: Americas (North, Central, and South America Only)

  • Please review the countries we're unable to hire from at this time here.

Hi There!

Zapier is hiring a Senior or Lead Product Manager to drive the future of our Developer Platform and Scout teams. We're open to hiring at either level depending on your skills, experiences, and how you perform in the interview process. These two critical teams you will lead, our Developer Platform and Scout teams. These are the core tools that enable our integration ecosystem to grow, scale, and evolve—with less manual effort and more intelligence.

In this role, you’ll shape how developers (internal and external) build and maintain integrations on Zapier. You’ll own proven, widely used platform capabilities—and pair them with new AI-powered tools that help authors move faster, avoid breakage, and automate more of the build lifecycle. Your work will make integration development easier, smarter, and 10x more scalable.

If you’re excited by developer platforms, shipping with engineers, and building the tools that power the rest of the product, you’ll love this role.

  • Our Commitment to Applicants

  • Culture and Values at Zapier

  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work

  • Zapier Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

About You

  • Technically fluent. You’ve been an engineer or worked closely with developer products. You’re comfortable discussing APIs, SDKs, and tooling trade-offs with engineering.

  • Energized by platform impact. You thrive when success means empowering thousands of integration builders, both internal engineers and external partners, to move faster and build better.

  • Experienced with mature products. You know how to navigate the complexity of long-lived platforms, balancing incremental improvement with bold upgrades while maintaining reliability for a massive existing ecosystem.

  • A natural influencer. You can get cross-functional teams and stakeholders to buy in, align on what’s best for the entire integration ecosystem, and build together.

  • Comfortable with the innovation spectrum. You can seamlessly move between optimizing proven platform tools and pioneering experimental AI workflows, understanding how they complement each other in service of the same mission.

  • Product-minded platform thinker. You excel at understanding how internal products evolve and translating those needs into upstream platform capabilities, preventing downstream teams from building workarounds for problems better solved at the platform level.

Things You’ll Do

  • Own the complete integration development lifecycle by evolving Zapier’s Developer Platform (improving integration tooling, enabling partner-owned integration maintenance, reducing bugs) while simultaneously pioneering AI-powered development acceleration through Scout.

  • Drive a unified product vision that connects mature platform capabilities with emerging AI tools, ensuring new innovations enhance rather than fragment the developer experience.

  • Partner with engineering to deliver reliable, scalable systems that serve both immediate platform needs and long-term ecosystem automation goals.

  • Rally other squads around shared platform goals, selling the vision of intelligent, self-improving integration tooling, building consensus, and driving collaborative delivery.

  • Translate complex technical opportunities into compelling product cases that demonstrate how platform stability and AI innovation create compound value for our 8,000+ app ecosystem.

  • Define success metrics across the full spectrum—from platform reliability and developer productivity to AI automation effectiveness—and adapt roadmaps to ensure maximum impact.

  • Act as the primary liaison between internal product teams and the Developer Platform, proactively identifying when multiple teams are solving similar problems independently and consolidating those solutions into shared platform capabilities.

Compensation

We determine level and compensation based on demonstrated experience and interview performance. Our transparent compensation bands:

  • Senior Product Manager:

    • Base: $170,700 (min) — $213,400 (mid) — $256,100 (max)

  • Lead Product Manager:

    • Base: $206,600 (min) — $258,200 (mid) — $309,800 (max)

Zapier also offers competitive equity packages, benefits, and a fully remote, async-friendly culture you can find more details here.

At Zapier, we believe that diverse perspectives and experiences make us better, which is why we have a non-standard application process designed to promote inclusion and equity. We're looking for the best fit for each of our roles, regardless of the type of companies in your background, so we encourage you to apply even if your skills and experiences don’t exactly match the job description. Education is not a requirement for our roles; however, if you receive an offer, you will need to include your most recent educational experience as part of our background check process.

After you apply, you are going to hear back from us—even if we don’t see an immediate fit with our team. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to never go more than seven days without letting you know the status of your application. We know we’ll make mistakes from time to time, so if you ever have questions about where you stand or about the process, just ask your recruiter!

Zapier is an equal-opportunity employer and we're excited to work with talented and empathetic people of all identities. Zapier does not discriminate based on someone's identity in any aspect of hiring or employment as required by law and in line with our commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base. Zapier will consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.

If reasonable accommodations are needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact jobs@zapier.com.

Application Deadline:

The anticipated application window is 30 days from the date job is posted, unless the number of applicants requires it to close sooner or later, or if the position is filled.

Hi there!

Hi there! Zapier is looking for an Engineering Manager to lead our Developer Impact team, part of the Zapier Internal Platforms zone. We’re on a mission to make everyone more productive at work through the power of automation, and that includes our own engineers. Zapier has helped millions of people build businesses through the power of our automation platform. Now, we want to ensure our developers have equally amazing tools and processes internally to build the future of automation with velocity and confidence.

Zapier’s Developer Impact team is focused on improving the effectiveness and velocity of our engineering organization. We do this by applying insights and innovations in development tooling and processes – with a strong emphasis on AI-powered developer workflows and cutting-edge productivity tooling. As the Engineering Manager for Developer Impact, you'll shape and drive this mission, working across the company to eliminate friction in the software development life cycle.

This isn’t your typical DevEx team. We take a hypothesis-driven, experimental approach to internal tooling, rapidly testing ideas and measuring their impact. We heavily leverage applied AI – from intelligent code assistants to automated CI pipelines – to reduce toil and supercharge our developers’ flow. We also keep our scope nimble, building lightweight solutions that we dogfood internally and quickly adapt as technology and team needs evolve. If you’re excited about high-leverage opportunities to boost engineering productivity, and you love collaborating in a culture of creative experimentation, you’ll thrive in this role.

If you're eager to lead high-impact projects at a fast-growing, profitable, and remote-first company, read on!

  • Our Commitment to Applicants

  • Culture and Values at Zapier

  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work

  • Zapier Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

About You

  • Developer Productivity Leader: You have experience leading teams focused on developer productivity, developer experience, or internal platforms. You treat internal engineers as your customers – empathizing with their pain points and delivering solutions that make their work easier and faster.

  • Skilled Team Builder: You’re a proven engineering leader (with a few years of management under your belt) who knows how to hire, develop, and retain great talent.

  • Experimental & Data-Driven: You thrive in a hypothesis-driven environment. You love to experiment with new tools or processes to improve workflow, measure the results with data, and iterate based on what you learn. Change doesn’t scare you – you embrace it as an opportunity to improve and leverage new ideas.

  • Technical Aptitude: You’ve shipped production code and have a solid grasp of modern software development practices. You have hands-on familiarity with things like CI/CD pipelines, version control, code review processes, and cloud infrastructure. You’ve likely built or improved internal tools or automation for a dev team before, so you can dive into technical discussions and guide your team in making sound engineering decisions.

  • Applied AI Enthusiast: You have interest or experience in applying AI/ML to developer workflows. Maybe you’ve used AI coding assistants, automated testing tools, or other AI-driven development aids – or you’re eager to learn and adopt them. You stay curious about emerging tech (AI included) that can reduce developer toil and improve efficiency.

  • Product Mindset: You think like a product manager when it comes to internal tooling. You can balance quick wins (e.g. automating a tedious manual task) with long-term investments (e.g. a standardized framework or service template). You prioritize work that delivers high leverage for the business, and you’re comfortable adjusting the roadmap as the needs of the engineering org evolve.

  • Strong Communicator & Collaborator: You build strong relationships across teams. You can align with Product, Design, Infrastructure, and other stakeholders on a shared vision for engineering excellence. You communicate complex ideas with clarity and ensure your team’s work and impact are understood across the organization. You’re adept at gathering feedback from others and explaining the “why” behind decisions.

  • Mentorship & Growth Orientation: You love helping engineers level up. You provide coaching, constructive feedback, and mentorship to your team, and you encourage a culture of continuous learning. You have a knack for identifying people’s strengths and developing opportunities for them to shine.

Things You’ll Do

  • Lead the Developer Impact team: Manage and mentor a small, nimble team of engineers dedicated to developer productivity. You’ll set the vision and direction, and keep the team focused on high-impact projects.

  • Identify & Eliminate Friction: Work closely with engineers on product teams to discover pain points in their day-to-day development process. You’ll solicit feedback through surveys, shadowing, and conversations, then prioritize and address the biggest friction points to dramatically increase developer velocity across Zapier.

  • Champion the “Golden Path”: Collaborate with our internal platform teams to define and promote a golden path of best practices, standardized tech stacks, service templates, and frameworks. You’ll drive adoption of these standards, making it easier for engineers to do the right thing by default when building new services or features.

  • Own Internal Documentation & Templates: Oversee Zapier’s internal developer documentation strategy, ensuring engineers have clear, discoverable guides for how we build software. Your team will maintain up-to-date service templates, example apps, and reference implementations so that starting a new project is frictionless and consistent.

  • Apply AI to Developer Workflows: Explore, experiment with, and implement AI-powered tooling to solve real development challenges. This could mean integrating AI assistants into code editors or code review processes, using machine learning to optimize test pipelines, or prototyping chatbots that help developers find information faster. You’ll bring practical AI solutions to bear on our software development lifecycle.

  • Build Lightweight, Adaptable Tools: Create and maintain a suite of internal tools and automations that make our engineers’ lives easier – from command-line utilities to CI/CD enhancements. You’ll ensure these solutions are lightweight and well-documented, and you’ll dogfood them within the team first to iterate quickly based on real-world use.

  • Continuous Feedback & Iteration: Establish feedback loops with the engineering organization. You’ll gather input and usage data on the tools and processes your team introduces, measure their impact (e.g. reductions in build times, improved deploy frequency, developer satisfaction), and iterate rapidly. Success for this team means high adoption and tangible improvements in how quickly and safely we ship code.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Zapier’s broader AI initiatives and other platform engineering teams. You’ll share insights and tooling between teams, avoid duplication of effort, and align internal developer experience improvements with the company’s overall technology strategy.

  • Communication & Advocacy: Champion developer experience at Zapier. You’ll communicate your team’s plans, progress, and wins to the rest of the company through updates, demos, and documentation. Part of your job is evangelizing the value of internal tooling and ensuring that engineering leadership is aware of the leverage your team provides.

  • Grow the Team (as needed): Participate in hiring processes for your team and others. You’ll help attract diverse talent, conduct interviews, and smoothly onboard new hires so they quickly feel at home and productive at Zapier.

How to Apply

Change doesn’t scare you – you embrace it as an opportunity to improve and leverage new ideas.

 - Technical Aptitude: You’ve shipped production code and have a solid grasp of modern software development practices. You have hands-on familiarity with things like CI/CD pipelines, version control, code review processes, and cloud infrastructure. You’ve likely built or improved internal tools or automation for a dev team before, so you can dive into technical discussions and guide your team in making sound engineering decisions.

 - Applied AI Enthusiast: You have interest or experience in applying AI/ML to developer workflows. Maybe you’ve used AI coding assistants, automated testing tools, or other AI-driven development aids – or you’re eager to learn and adopt them. You stay curious about emerging tech (AI included) that can reduce developer toil and improve efficiency.

 - Product Mindset: You think like a product manager when it comes to internal tooling. You can balance quick wins (e.g. automating a tedious manual task) with long-term investments (e.g. a standardized framework or service template). You prioritize work that delivers high leverage for the business, and you’re comfortable adjusting the roadmap as the needs of the engineering org evolve.

 - Strong Communicator & Collaborator: You build strong relationships across teams. You can align with Product, Design, Infrastructure, and other stakeholders on a shared vision for engineering excellence. You communicate complex ideas with clarity and ensure your team’s work and impact are understood across the organization. You’re adept at gathering feedback from others and explaining the “why” behind decisions.

 - Mentorship & Growth Orientation: You love helping engineers level up. You provide coaching, constructive feedback, and mentorship to your team, and you encourage a culture of continuous learning. You have a knack for identifying people’s strengths and developing opportunities for them to shine.
   


THINGS YOU’LL DO

 - Lead the Developer Impact team: Manage and mentor a small, nimble team of engineers dedicated to developer productivity. You’ll set the vision and direction, and keep the team focused on high-impact projects.

 - Identify & Eliminate Friction: Work closely with engineers on product teams to discover pain points in their day-to-day development process. You’ll solicit feedback through surveys, shadowing, and conversations, then prioritize and address the biggest friction points to dramatically increase developer velocity across Zapier.

 - Champion the “Golden Path”: Collaborate with our internal platform teams to define and promote a golden path of best practices, standardized tech stacks, service templates, and frameworks. You’ll drive adoption of these standards, making it easier for engineers to do the right thing by default when building new services or features.

 - Own Internal Documentation & Templates: Oversee Zapier’s internal developer documentation strategy, ensuring engineers have clear, discoverable guides for how we build software. Your team will maintain up-to-date service templates, example apps, and reference implementations so that starting a new project is frictionless and consistent.

 - Apply AI to Developer Workflows: Explore, experiment with, and implement AI-powered tooling to solve real development challenges. This could mean integrating AI assistants into code editors or code review processes, using machine learning to optimize test pipelines, or prototyping chatbots that help developers find information faster. You’ll bring practical AI solutions to bear on our software development lifecycle.

 - Build Lightweight, Adaptable Tools: Create and maintain a suite of internal tools and automations that make our engineers’ lives easier – from command-line utilities to CI/CD enhancements. You’ll ensure these solutions are lightweight and well-documented, and you’ll dogfood them within the team first to iterate quickly based on real-world use.

 - Continuous Feedback & Iteration: Establish feedback loops with the engineering organization. You’ll gather input and usage data on the tools and processes your team introduces, measure their impact (e.g. reductions in build times, improved deploy frequency, developer satisfaction), and iterate rapidly. Success for this team means high adoption and tangible improvements in how quickly and safely we ship code.

 - Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Zapier’s broader AI initiatives and other platform engineering teams. You’ll share insights and tooling between teams, avoid duplication of effort, and align internal developer experience improvements with the company’s overall technology strategy.

Part of your job is evangelizing the value of internal tooling and ensuring that engineering leadership is aware of the leverage your team provides.

We're humans who simply think computers should do more work.

You work closely with cross-functional partners to understand their goals, shape the right questions, and deliver insights that drive action. You’re comfortable working with senior leaders and adjusting your communication to the audience by telling concise, effective stories that make the case for action.

  • You build for scale and enablement. You help teams define and own their KPIs, build self-serve dashboards, and use data to make better decisions faster. You create systems and documentation that make insight accessible—not just available.

  • You are a skilled written communicator. Zapier is a 100% remote team and writing is our primary means of communication. You communicate complex technical topics clearly and in an approachable way.

In fact, throughout the process, we strive to never go more than seven days without letting you know the status of your application. We know we’ll make mistakes from time to time, so if you ever have questions about where you stand or about the process, just ask your recruiter!

In this role, we’re looking for a strategic leader who will define and drive Zapier’s product-led organic discovery and growth strategy. This role owns the long-term vision and roadmap for how Zapier is discovered across search engines, GPTs, and the social channels that influence those, and how that discovery translates into PLG signups through seamless, product-driven experiences.

A background in product management is beneficial for this role, but it's not a requirement. We believe with the right tools and support, if you're experienced and obsessed with user acquisition and growth strategy, you'll lead this team to its next growth curve.

If you’re interested in being part of a fast-growing, profitable, impact-driven company, then read on…

 - You’re skilled at setting a roadmap and executing against it. You know how to translate strategy into a sequenced plan and you work with engineering and design to deliver on it.

 - You’re both analytical and intuitive. You rely on data to shape decisions, but you also bring product sense and user empathy to identify opportunities others might miss.

 - You’re a cross-functional leader. You have experience working with engineers, designers, content creators, and business partners to deliver scalable solutions. You create clarity in ambiguous spaces and build alignment around shared goals.

 - You’re a strong communicator. You can use written communication to articulate strategy, roadmaps, and results across a distributed team. You know how to connect daily work to the bigger narrative of Zapier’s growth.

 - Build scalable, templated product-led pages and flows that convert high-intent discovery traffic into signups.

 - Shape Zapier’s GEO strategy to ensure Zapier is the authoritative automation brand surfaced in generative AI search and assistants.

 - Run experiments that not only drive signups, but have a meaningful impact on product usage and revenue.

 - Expand Zapier’s offsite discovery footprint where prospects are making automation decisions.

 - Work closely with designers, engineers, and content creators to ensure we’re delivering a high-quality customer experience.

 - Align the team and stakeholders of the team around a common goal. You create a collaborative environment where the best ideas are pursued regardless of who comes up with them.

 - Regularly report on the results of the team; be a truth seeker in order to establish a culture of learning and forward progress.

About Zapier

We're humans who simply think computers should do more work.

At Zapier, we’re not just making software—we’re building a platform to help millions of businesses globally scale with automation and AI. Our mission is to make automation work for everyone by delivering products that delight our customers. You’ll collaborate with brilliant people, use the latest tools, and leverage the flexibility of remote work. Your work will directly fuel our customers’ success, and as they grow, so will you.

Job Posted: 10/8/2025

Location: NAMER

Want to learn more about working at Zapier?

We know we have a lot of competition for your skills. If you’re wondering what things would be like at Zapier, read on about:

  • Our Commitment to Applicants

  • Culture and Values at Zapier

  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work

  • Zapier Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

Staff Site Reliability Engineer

Zapier's Internal Platform exists to provide engineers with a reliable, frictionless foundation to build, ship, and operate software. We’re looking for a Staff Site Reliability Engineer with deep observability expertise and a proven track record of leading company-wide change. You’ll join our Reliability Platform team, where we own incident response, service ownership, and observability, and you’ll play a pivotal role in strengthening Zapier’s posture across all three.

Why This Role Matters

This isn’t just an infrastructure or tooling role. We're looking for someone to set and drive a multi-year reliability strategy that enables Zapier engineers to deliver reliable products at scale. You'll need to influence organizational culture and practice—shaping how engineers instrument, monitor, debug, and learn from their systems.

You’ll be a technical leader across teams and a mentor to engineers tackling complex systems problems. You won’t just build observability tools—you’ll define what “good” looks like, partner with service teams to get there, and help elevate reliability practices across the organization.

About You

  • You’re a seasoned engineer. You have 10+ years of experience in systems engineering and software development, including Staff+ level roles where you’ve led broadly scoped, high-impact initiatives.

  • You’re a builder first. You lead through hands-on contribution and aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves to make things happen. You thrive on jumping in alongside product teams to solve problems directly, unblock adoption of platform practices, and demonstrate what “good” looks like by building it. You’re energized by executing—not just advising.

  • Observability is your craft. You have deep, hands-on experience designing and operationalizing observability systems across metrics, logs, traces, and profiling. You understand what it takes to turn telemetry into actionable insight—and build a culture that values it.

  • You lead systemic change. You've defined and driven adoption of practices like SLOs, golden paths, and instrumentation standards across multiple teams or organizations. You’ve helped teams evolve from reactive to proactive reliability.

  • You design for scale and ambiguity. You can design systems and solutions in complex, high-scale environments—where priorities are fluid and ambiguity is the norm.

  • You’re a strategic thinker. You can define a long-term vision and identify incremental paths to achieve it. You balance business goals, technical constraints, and developer experience.

  • You are customer- and team-oriented. You have empathy for both internal engineers and the end users they serve. You’re able to translate needs across organizational layers, balancing tactical team needs with strategic business impact. You collaborate effectively with ICs, EMs, and executives alike, and you build trust by listening first and aligning on outcomes.

  • You’re a strong communicator. You’re great at tailoring communication to different audiences—whether writing RFCs, mentoring engineers, or aligning leaders on tradeoffs and priorities.

  • You are an AI power user. You proactively embrace AI as a core part of your engineering toolkit and are excited to explore new ways it can accelerate learning, development, and operations. You don’t just use AI—you advocate for it, sharing your workflows and helping others level up.

Things You’ll Do

  • Lead Zapier’s observability strategy. Define standards and best practices for instrumentation, telemetry, alerting, and visibility. Build prototypes, drive adoption, and work directly with engineers to embed observability into their workflows.

  • Accelerate platform adoption. Actively partner with product and platform teams to remove friction in adopting golden paths for observability, service ownership, and incident response. Where adoption lags, jump in and help build the missing pieces.

  • Elevate our incident lifecycle. Help teams prevent, detect, and respond to incidents more effectively, and strengthen how we analyze and learn from them.

  • Mentor and guide engineers. Share your expertise across the SRE and broader engineering org. Uplevel teams’ understanding of reliability principles, observability tooling, and service ownership practices.

  • Influence service maturity. Contribute to shaping what “owning a service” means at Zapier—including improving how engineers measure and understand reliability.

  • Drive platform-wide projects. Collaborate across infrastructure, product, and data teams on initiatives like distributed tracing, centralized logging, or unified health dashboards.

  • Act as a reliability steward. Partner with other Staff Engineers and Engineering Leaders to evolve Zapier’s engineering practices and reliability posture at scale.

  • Champion AI integration. Use AI tools to optimize development, debugging, analysis, and documentation workflows—and support others in doing the same.

Our Stack & Tools

  • Cloud & Infra: AWS, Kubernetes, Redis, Kafka, Terraform

  • Observability: Grafana, Datadog, Opensearch, Prometheus, Sentry

  • Languages: Go, Python, TypeScript

  • CI/CD & Source Control: GitLab, ArgoCD

What Success Looks Like

  • Observability is seen not as a platform function, but as an engineering-wide discipline.

  • Zapier teams can confidently answer: “Is my service healthy?”

  • SLOs are not only defined, but actively used to guide engineering decisions.

  • Incidents are detected faster, recur less, and are learned from more effectively.

  • Teams feel empowered and supported in owning the reliability of their systems.

  • AI tooling is embedded across reliability workflows, increasing speed, quality, and experience.

How to Apply

At Zapier, we believe that diverse perspectives and experiences make us better, which is why we have a non-standard application process designed to promote inclusion and equity. We're looking for the best fit for each of our roles, regardless of the type of companies in your background, so we encourage you to apply even if your skills and experiences don’t exactly match the job description. All we ask is that you answer a few in-depth questions in our application that would typically be asked at the start of an interview process. This helps speed things up by letting us get to know you and your skillset a bit better right out of the gate. Please be sure to answer each question; the resume and CV fields are optional.

Education is not a requirement for our roles; however, if you receive an offer, you will need to include your most recent educational experience as part of our background check process.

After you apply, you are going to hear back from us—even if we don’t see an immediate fit with our team. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to never go more than seven days without letting you know the status of your application. We know we’ll make mistakes from time to time, so if you ever have questions about where you stand or about the process, just ask your recruiter!

Zapier is an equal-opportunity employer and we're excited to work with talented and empathetic people of all identities. Zapier does not discriminate based on someone's identity in any aspect of hiring or employment as required by law and in line with our commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base. Zapier will consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.

Zapier prioritizes the security of our customers' information and is dedicated to adhering to all applicable data privacy laws. You can review our privacy policy here.

Zapier is committed to inclusion. As part of this commitment, Zapier welcomes applications from individuals with disabilities and will work to provide reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodations are needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact jobs@zapier.com.

Application Deadline:

The anticipated application window is 30 days from the date job is posted, unless the number of applicants requires it to close sooner or later, or if the position is filled.

Hi there!

We’re looking for a Senior Partner Manager to join Zapier’s Ecosystems & Channels organization. This role will drive the strategic opportunity pipeline and launches across our integration partner ecosystem: creating playbooks, identifying new opportunities, and driving execution with both unmanaged and managed partners. You’ll focus on unlocking the next wave of growth for Zapier by ensuring our partner portfolio evolves in line with our most critical company objectives.

Zapier’s Ecosystems & Channels organization sits at the center of our go-to-market strategy. With 8,000+ SaaS partner integrations and a rapidly growing AI app ecosystem, our team drives impact by deepening integrations, enabling valuable use cases for our joint customers, and opening entirely new growth pathways. As a Senior Partner Manager, you’ll build and execute initiatives that accelerate adoption, expand our integration partner footprint, and transform how we scale our partner motions.

Zapier is the most connected AI orchestration platform for the Enterprise. As the connective tissue for modern AI systems, our platform orchestrates over 8,000 apps, tools, and APIs, enabling companies to deploy AI in powerful, scalable ways without rebuilding their stack. As AI evolves, we need forward-thinking teammates who understand this emerging landscape and can help our customers and partners navigate it.

  • Negotiate new partnerships. Lead conversations with enterprise SaaS and AI partners to identify high-impact relationships.

  • Create playbooks. Codify approaches from initial outreach to activation to scaling that can be used across the partner management team and function. Know when to make changes to roles and responsibilities across the motions to maximize efficiency of the process and teams involved.

  • Identify and manage marketing opportunities surrounding new partnerships and launches either through the partner’s GTM channels, Zapier’s, or both.

  • Challenge the status quo and effect positive organizational change outside of mandated work.

Strategic Partnerships can mean so many different things at different companies, so before you apply, let us explain what it means at Zapier. The Partnerships team generates outsized impact with our biggest partners. With 8,000+ partners in our ecosystem (and growing), this team focuses on developing meaningful partnerships with market leaders in AI/SaaS/Technology that can significantly impact our growth by co-developing integrated product experiences and promoting them to our common users at scale. We create first-of-their-kind product experiences with partners that will be seen by millions of users, ensure our most popular integrations are continuously improved, and develop custom joint marketing campaigns to drive increased awareness and activation.

As a Strategic Partner Manager, you will be responsible for a focused portfolio of new and existing strategic partners. You’ll educate, motivate, and secure commitments from these partners, resulting in compelling product experiences that bring new enterprises to Zapier. This is the ideal position for entrepreneurial individuals who excel at understanding the needs of technology partners, are intrigued by innovative products and technologies, and can architect mutually beneficial growth strategies. Your ability to build relationships, both internally and externally, will be critical, as will be your resourcefulness, analytical skills, and grit.

Zapier is on a mission to make automation work for everyone—and our global, all-remote team is what makes this work possible. If you’re interested in advancing your career at a fast-growing, profitable, impact-driven company, then read on…

  • Culture and Values at Zapier

  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work

  • Zapier Code of Conduct

  • Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

​

About You

You’ve done this before. You have 8+ years of experience developing partnerships and net-new business, particularly with larger, more complex technology partners. You can point to a portfolio of multiple high-value partnerships and/or deals that you led from start to finish.

You’re a relationship builder. You easily connect with individuals and identify areas of collaboration. You have the ability to navigate large organizations and find/influence the key decision makers. Prior experience working with or within large technology companies is important.

You have prior sales experience. You have experience pitching, negotiating, and winning new business, crafting your own narratives, and operating under revenue-based performance goals. Bonus points if you’ve managed co-selling programs with large enterprise partners.

You know SaaS. You have a deep understanding of SaaS partner ecosystems and experience in developing and creating win-win co-developed product experiences. Ideally, you’re already a subject matter expert in a key category where Zapier operates.

You have product and marketing savvy. You have an intuition for a partner's product and can quickly assess what product challenges Zapier can help solve. You will be expected to quickly build credibility with internal and external Product Managers and GTM counterparts.

You’re technical, and eager to use AI to increase your impact. You’re able to assess a partner’s product + APIs, understand where a partnership with Zapier can add value, and provide guidance to external + internal developers on how a co-developed product solutions can/should look. You may not be a coder by trade, but you’re comfortable using AI tools to generate prototypes, and you can hold your own in conversations with product and engineering teams.

You are data driven. You use data to develop strategy, and have comfort self-serving the insights you need from BI tools. You measure your work and outcomes with our strategic partners to ensure continued performance.

You’re an excellent communicator. You understand the value we provide to partners and can transparently articulate your point of view to partners and internal stakeholders in both verbal and written formats. We are, and always have been, a 100% remote team, and writing is our primary means of communication at Zapier.

You get Zapier. You’re already familiar with the workflow automation space. Deep understanding of Zapier and our ecosystem is a strong requirement for this role.

  • Build, grow, and own external partner relationships for Zapier, establishing Zapier as the automation partner-of-choice in the market, managing a pipeline of partnership opportunities from ideation to execution

  • Work with Zapier’s most strategic partners to co-develop best-in-class product solutions + experiences for our shared users.

  • Develop, negotiate, pilot, and scale new revenue and distribution models for Zapier hand-in-hand with strategic partners and internal product + go-to-market teams

  • Support go-to-market efforts for Zapier’s current & future products where partners play a key role

  • Move large projects forward by driving internal & external alignment with a diverse group of cross-functional stakeholders, including Product, Operations, Data, Marketing, Legal

  • In addition to traveling for company/team summits, you will meet in person with strategic Zapier partners at least quarterly, most of whom are located in the San Francisco Bay area.
